Aura: Righteous Call.name: Aura: Gerechte Berufung
Aura: Righteous Call.description:
Gewährt durch @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.adventure-specific-actions.Item.EbF9U21iMu0JkTzG]{Gerechte Berufung}

Angriffe deiner Verbündeten innerhalb von 30 Fuß/9 m zu dir erhalten die Kategorie Heilig.

Effect: Attitude.name: Effect: Attitude
Effect: Attitude.description:
See @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.journals.JournalEntry.S55aqwWIzpQRFhcq.JournalEntryPage.CtFrwkS2yJ64080e]{Attitudes}

Use this effect to keep track of the attitude of relevant NPCs, increasing or decreasing the effect's badge value as needed.

Effect: Azata's Grace.name: Effekt: Azatas Anmut
Effect: Azata's Grace.description:
Gewährt durch @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.adventure-specific-actions.Item.p4CE62CG9S9RpU5F]{Azatas Anmut}

Du erhältst 50 zusätzliche Trefferpunkte, wodurch sich deine maximalen und aktuellen Trefferpunkte erhöhen, außerdem erhältst du die Effekte der Gabe Gerechte Berufung.

Effect: Bickering Family.name: Effect: Bickering Family
Effect: Bickering Family.description: You gain a +1 status bonus to your saving throws.

Effect: Boar Form.name: Effect: Boar Form
Effect: Boar Form.description:
The polymorphed character transforms into a Large animal. Each polymorphed character gains the following statistics and abilities regardless of which form they choose.

  • AC = 36.
  • 30 temporary Hit Points.
  • Low-light vision and scent (imprecise) 30 feet.
  • One or more unarmed melee attacks specific to the battle form, which are the only attacks you can use. (You are trained with them.) You can use your own unarmed attack modifier if it is better.
  • Athletics modifier of +26 unless yours is better.
  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.adventure-specific-actions.Item.LVSGvlzI1rGWtGJA]{Rallying Display} 1 (auditory, visual) You roar or otherwise make a show of bestial strength. You automatically roll a success to rally the crowd for your team.
  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.adventure-specific-actions.Item.oUP8jylH97ZbRvfw]{Reposition Chains} 1 You pull on the chains, moving a willing chained ally up to 10 feet to a space within your reach.

Speed 40 feet

Melee 1 tusk +25, Damage 3d10+16 piercing

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.adventure-specific-actions.Item.71ypBixnbV4bE5Hv]{Chained Charge} 2 You Stride and then make a tusk Strike at the end of your movement. If you move farther than 15 feet from your chained allies, you pull them along to the nearest open space 15 feet behind you. The creature you hit must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:35] save or fall @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Effect: Burned Mouth and Throat (Linguis.name: Effekt: Mund und Kehle verbrannt (Sprache)
Effect: Burned Mouth and Throat (Linguis.description: Verbrennt Mund und Kehle, was 1 Stunde lang einen Malus von -1 auf sprachbasierte Fertigkeitswürfe und SG verursacht.

Effect: Burned Mouth and Throat (No Sing.name: Effekt: Mund und Kehle verbrannt (Kein Schreien oder Singen)
Effect: Burned Mouth and Throat (No Sing.description: Der Trinker kann 8 Stunden lang weder schreien noch singen.

Effect: Burned Tongue (Linguistic).name: Effekt: Zunge verbrannt (Sprache)
Effect: Burned Tongue (Linguistic).description: Verbrennt die Zunge und verursacht 1 Minute lang einen Gegenstandsmalus von -1 auf sprachbasierte Fertigkeitswürfe und SG.

Effect: Burned Tongue (No Singing or Yel.name: Effekt: Zunge verbrannt (Kein Schreien oder Singen)
Effect: Burned Tongue (No Singing or Yel.description: Der Trinker kann 1 Stunde lang weder schreien noch singen.

Effect: Call Upon the Ancients.name: Effect: Call Upon the Ancients
Effect: Call Upon the Ancients.description: You gain resistance 5 to all damage caused by Treerazer.

Effect: Call Upon the Sovyrian Stone.name: Effect: Call Upon the Sovyrian Stone
Effect: Call Upon the Sovyrian Stone.description: Decrease the DC of Treerazer's primal innate spells and his Defoliation ability to DC 46, the DC of his aura of corruption to DC 43, and his spell attack modifier to +38.

Effect: Chthonic Mucus.name: Effect: Chthonic Mucus
Effect: Chthonic Mucus.description: The creature takes a –5-foot status penalty to their Speed. This reduction ends with the persistent spirit damage.

Effect: Chthonic Mucus (1-2).name: Effect: Chthonic Mucus (1-2)
Effect: Chthonic Mucus (1-2).description: The creature takes a -5-foot status penalty to its Speed for 1 round.

Effect: Combat Mentor.name: Effect: Combat Mentor
Effect: Combat Mentor.description:
Granted by Combat Mentor

Your Level Bump modifier to attack rolls and spell attack rolls increases to 2.

Effect: Consecrated Altar to Ydersius.name: Effekt: Geweihter Altar für Ydersius
Effect: Consecrated Altar to Ydersius.description: Kreaturen, die Ydersius verehren, erhalten einen +1 Zustandsbonus auf Angriffswürfe, Fertigkeitswürfe, Rettungswürfe und Wahrnehmungswürfe, und ihre Angriffe erhalten die Kategorie Unheilig.

Effect: Crownhold Consecration.name: Effect: Crownhold Consecration
Effect: Crownhold Consecration.description:
Worshippers of Gorum get a +1 status bonus to attack rolls, skill checks, saving throws, and Perception checks.

In addition, the underhanded nature of the PCs causes them to take a –1 status penalty to attack rolls, skill checks, saving throws, and Perception.

Effect: Exotic Edge.name: Effect: Exotic Edge
Effect: Exotic Edge.description:
Granted by Exotic Edge

You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to either all of your attack rolls or all of your skill checks.

Effect: Extreme stomach cramps.name: Effekt: Extreme Magenkrämpfe
Effect: Extreme stomach cramps.description: Du kannst 8 Stunden lang nichts mehr willentlich zu dir nehmen, auch keine anderen Getränke

Effect: Forgive Foe.name: Effekt: Gegner vergeben
Effect: Forgive Foe.description:
Gewährt durch @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.adventure-specific-actions.Item.764EVGVADrDSbdqu]{Gegner vergeben}

Das Ziel erleidet einen Zustandsmalus von -2 auf alle Angriffswürfe, den SG seiner Effekte und seinen WIL-SG gegenüber weiteren Handlungen Gegner vergeben bis zum Ende deines nächsten Zuges.

Effect: Grand Finale.name: Effect: Grand Finale
Effect: Grand Finale.description:
Granted by Grand Finale

You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Performance checks, 20 temporary Hit Points, and a +1 circumstance bonus to Fortitude saves.

Effect: Heightened Awareness.name: Effekt: Erhöhte Aufmerksamkeit
Effect: Heightened Awareness.description: Erhöhte Aufmerksamkeit, gewährt 8 Stunden lang einen Gegenstandsbonus von +1 auf Wahrnehmungswürfe zum @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Suchen}

Effect: Heroic Aegis.name: Effect: Heroic Aegis
Effect: Heroic Aegis.description:
Granted by Heroic Aegis

You gain a +2 status bonus to AC and saving throws.

Effect: Heroic Hustle.name: Effect: Heroic Hustle
Effect: Heroic Hustle.description:
Granted by Heroic Hustle

You gain a +10-foot status bonus to your Speed.

Effect: Heroic Inspiration.name: Effect: Heroic Inspiration
Effect: Heroic Inspiration.description:
Granted by Heroic Inspiration

You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to checks of the same type the origin succeeded against.

Effect: Hope or Despair (Critical Succes.name: Effekt: Hoffnung oder Verzweiflung (Kritischer Erfolg)
Effect: Hope or Despair (Critical Succes.description: Schelyn sieht in der Kreatur eine Chance, dem Schrein wieder zu neuem Ruhm zu verhelfen, und statt sie mit Verzweiflung zu erfüllen, erfüllt der Spuk sie mit Hoffnung. Sie ist nicht nur erfüllt von dem Drang, das Böse zu besiegen, das den Schrein befallen hat, die Kreatur verspürt außerdem den Drang, den Schrein wiederherzustellen. Genaue Einzelheiten über die Art des Übels, das den Schrein befallen hat, sind nicht ersichtlich, außer dass sie den Charakter darauf aufmerksam zu machen, dass es etwas Schreckliches innerhalb der Mauern des Schreins gibt. Die Kreatur muss nicht handeln, aber solange sie eines der beiden Ziele verfolgt, erhält sie einen Zustandsbonus von +1 auf alle Würfe, solange sie sich im Bereich des Schreins aufhält. Der Spielleiter bestimmt, ob ein Wurf für dieses Ziel zählt oder nicht (zumindest zählen alle Würfe im Kampf gegen Feinde im weiteren Verlauf des Abenteuers).

Effect: Hope or Despair (Failure or Crit.name: Effekt: Hoffnung oder Verzweiflung (Fehlschlag oder Kritischer Fehlschlag)
Effect: Hope or Despair (Failure or Crit.description:
Fehlschlag Gefühle der Traurigkeit und Verzweiflung steigen in der Seele der Kreatur hoch. Für die nächste Stunde erleidet die Kreatur einen Malus von -1 auf alle Rettungswürfe gegen Effekte der Kategorie Mental; dieser Malus erhöht sich auf -2 Malus gegen Effekte, die die Kategorein Gefühl und Mental besitzen. Dieser Effekt besitzt die Kategorie Fluch.

Kritischer Fehlschlag Wie beim Fehlschlag, aber die Auswirkungen halten an, solange die Grünvettel Tulvak die Kontrolle über den Schrein hat.

Effect: Immediate and Intense Headache.name: Effekt: Sofortige und starke Kopfschmerzen
Effect: Immediate and Intense Headache.description: Sofortige und starke Kopfschmerzen, die 8 Stunden lang eine Schwäche von 5 für mentalen Schaden verursachen

Effect: Improved reflexes.name: Effekt: Verbesserte Reflexe
Effect: Improved reflexes.description: Verbesserte Reflexe, die 8 Stunden lang einen Gegenstandsbonus von +1 auf Reflexwürfe gewähren

Effect: Invoke the Witchbole's Spirit.name: Effect: Invoke the Witchbole's Spirit
Effect: Invoke the Witchbole's Spirit.description: PCs gain a +4 circumstance bonus to all saving throws against Witchbole Collapse effects. Conversely, Treerazer takes a –4 circumstance penalty to his saving throws against the same effects.

Effect: Keen insight.name: Effekt: Scharfer Verstand
Effect: Keen insight.description: Scharfer Verstand, gewährt 8 Stunden lang einen Gegenstandsbonus von +1 auf Wahrnehmungswürfe zum @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1xRFPTFtWtGJ9ELw]{Motiv erkennen}

Effect: Light in the Dark.name: Effect: Light in the Dark
Effect: Light in the Dark.description:
Granted by S1-18 - Light in the Dark

You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Diplomacy checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.DCb62iCBrJXy0Ik6]{Request Assistance} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.OX4fy22hQgUHDr0q]{Make an Impression} while adventuring in Razmiran.

Effect: Little Ripple's Blessing.name: Effekt: Kleine Welles Segen
Effect: Little Ripple's Blessing.description:
Gewährt durch @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.adventure-specific-actions.Item.31uM8IkenDZdeid6]{Kleine Welles Segen}

Du erhältst einen Zustandsbonus von +1 auf Willenswürfe.

Effect: Magical Mentor.name: Effect: Magical Mentor
Effect: Magical Mentor.description:
Granted by Magical Mentor

Your Level Bump modifier bonus to your spell DC that is the same tradition of the mentor increases to 2.

Effect: Memories of Failure.name: Effect: Memories of Failure
Effect: Memories of Failure.description: You take a -1 penalty to all saving throws against emotion effects created by the marked creature.

Effect: Nexian Researcher.name: Effect: Nexian Researcher
Effect: Nexian Researcher.description:
Granted by S1-00 - Nexian Researcher

If you are Untrained in Pathfinder Society Lore, you can add your level to your Intelligence modifier when determining your bonus. If you are at least Trained in Pathfinder Society Lore, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to this check instead.

Effect: Pompous Rage.name: Effect: Pompous Rage
Effect: Pompous Rage.description: Foroxicks takes a –2 circumstance penalty to his jaws attack, but each hit deals additional piercing damage.

Effect: Practiced Medic.name: Effect: Practiced Medic
Effect: Practiced Medic.description:
Granted by Practiced Medic

You can improve a Medicine check's degree of success by one step to Administer First Aid, Treat Disease, Treat Poison, or Treat Wounds.

Effect: Protective Mentor.name: Effect: Protective Mentor
Effect: Protective Mentor.description:
Granted by Protective Mentor

Your maximum Hit Points increases in addition to the bonus provided by the Level Bump.

Effect: Recruit the Recent Dead.name: Effect: Recruit the Recent Dead
Effect: Recruit the Recent Dead.description: Reduce Treerazer's AC to 51, his Blackaxe Strike modifier to +44, and his jaws Strike modifier to +42.

Effect: Reflection of Life (Fast Healing.name: Effect: Reflection of Life (Fast Healing)
Effect: Reflection of Life (Fast Healing.description: You gain fast healing for 1 minute. This amount of fast healing starts at 3 and increases by 1 for every 2 levels you have beyond 5th level.

Effect: Resist Corruption.name: Effect: Resist Corruption
Effect: Resist Corruption.description:
Granted by Resist Corruption

You gain resistance to unholy equal to your Reputation Tier with the Vigilant Seal faction.

Effect: Righteous Call.name: Effekt: Gerechte Berufung
Effect: Righteous Call.description:
Gewährt durch @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.adventure-specific-actions.Item.EbF9U21iMu0JkTzG]{Gerechte Berufung}

Deine Angriffe erhalten die Kategorie Heilig.

Effect: Rugged Mentor.name: Effect: Rugged Mentor
Effect: Rugged Mentor.description:
Granted by Rugged Mentor

Your Level Bump modifier to saving throws increases to 2.

Effect: Seasonal Boon (Outskirt Dweller).name: Effect: Seasonal Boon (Outskirt Dweller)
Effect: Seasonal Boon (Outskirt Dweller).description: You gain a status bonus to your initiative roll equal to the number of seasons since you've started Season of Ghosts (+1 during the first adventure, up to a maximum of +4 during the fourth and final adventure).

Effect: Skillful Mentor.name: Effect: Skillful Mentor
Effect: Skillful Mentor.description:
Granted by Skillful Mentor

Your Level Bump modifier to skill checks increases to 2.

Effect: Spirit Power (Flight).name: Effect: Spirit Power (Flight)
Effect: Spirit Power (Flight).description: You gain a fly Speed equal to your Speed or 30 feet, whichever is greater.

Effect: Spirit Power (Passion).name: Effect: Spirit Power (Passion)
Effect: Spirit Power (Passion).description: your body is engulfed in fire of a color of your choice that sheds bright light in a 40-foot radius (and dim light to the next 40 feet). Your melee Strikes inflict an additional 1d6 points of fire damage, you gain resistance 10 to fire, and you gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.adventure-specific-actions.Item.kfmEGGs8DbIL9JuF]{Reactive Scorch} reaction.

Effect: Spirit Powers.name: Effect: Spirit Powers
Effect: Spirit Powers.description:
When the PCs @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.8Lk9K3tRnV68MQPW]{Transmigrate} into the living world during the third chapter of this adventure, they're ectoplasmic beings trapped somewhere between life and undeath. While in this state, the PCs function mostly normally, but appear as semi-solid ectoplasmic versions of themselves. They aren't quite transparent, but their solid bodies seem to waver and shimmer along the edges, giving them an eerie, unsettling appearance. While in this state, they're living creatures but gain some of the following abilities similar to those shared by undead creatures. As living creatures more akin to phantoms, they remain susceptible to negative damage and are healed by positive energy.

Undead Vision: They gain low-light vision, or darkvision if their ancestry already has low-light vision.

Transmigrated Survival: A PC in this state never gains the wounded condition, but instead becomes exposed to soul degradation upon recovering from the dying condition (see below). If a PC dies while transmigrated, they awaken, alive, in the Willowshore mindscape and gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1} condition.

Transmigrated Protection: They gain a +2 circumstance bonus to saving throws (or any other defense) against disease, poison, sleep, and any effects that would impose the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} condition.

Spirit Powers: While in this state, the PCs can also interact with the living world via their newfound spirit powers. When the PCs manifest their transmigrated bodies in the living world, they each gain two minor spirit powers and one major spirit power from the spirit powers listed below. Every time the PCs do their daily preparations, they can reselect their chosen spirit powers. When a spirit power calls for a saving throw, use the higher of that PC's class DC or spell DC. Any spirit powers calling for attack rolls use this DC – 10. Use the PC's own level for determining the effects of any counteract checks.

Soul Degradation: Initially, PCs will likely revel in their newfound spirit powers. Whenever a transmigrated PC comes close to death, however, they risk losing themselves entirely to their ghostly nature. Each time a dying transmigrated PC would normally gain the wounded condition, they're instead exposed to soul degradation and must attempt a new saving throw to resist increasing the stage of this curse.

Minor Spirit Powers

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.adventure-specific-actions.Item.VMpc8QWEZxSH8Mr4]{Curiosity}

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.adventure-specific-actions.Item.fsxCcyWpag5iuWOU]{Delusion}

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.adventure-specific-actions.Item.ekiKKfsBDFEeVmun]{Duty}

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.adventure-specific-actions.Item.w4t0ElpqNQRFCaPJ]{Love}

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.adventure-specific-actions.Item.g6iKvH7Y3InQtZ8K]{Obsession}

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.adventure-specific-actions.Item.w1nzN61S6NfkDH7Y]{Passion}

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.adventure-specific-actions.Item.YdG3UwVBia5AyLjO]{Spite}

Major Spirit Powers

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.adventure-specific-actions.Item.DVILYNQVB2hx9Chl]{Chilling Paralysis}

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.adventure-specific-actions.Item.pHXGTgjwWY3OBRF2]{Dematerialize}

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.adventure-specific-actions.Item.0HChyDaXdpXN11q4]{Flickering Figure}

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.adventure-specific-actions.Item.SnIvcCNASDzgevQK]{Flight}

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.adventure-specific-actions.Item.3yYlHV7GBrafsDwE]{Grudge}

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.adventure-specific-actions.Item.KtqDsKBuOmCkbDcR]{Resist Death}

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.adventure-specific-actions.Item.KbQXDTBi5MKtHbpU]{River's Reflection}

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.adventure-specific-actions.Item.sjLNgLFyDvTt6VVV]{Sap Life}

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.adventure-specific-actions.Item.UnQ8oHYc0dBJHZv9]{Undying Flesh}
Effect: Spirit Powers.gmNote:
Soul Degradation (Curse 7)

rare

curse

magical

The PC's sense of self becomes subsumed by ghostly desires, eventually rendering them a senseless shell. Soul degradation doesn't increase or decrease its stage over the passage of time. Instead, each time a transmigrated PC recovers from the dying condition, they must attempt a new saving throw against this curse. Certain events or effects that the PCs might encounter in Chapter 3 of this adventure can also force them to save against soul degradation. Once the effects of transmigration end for a PC, they immediately and fully recover from soul degradation.

Saving Throw @Check[will|dc:23|traits:curse,magical]

Stage 1 weakness 5 to positive damage

Stage 2 weakness 10 to positive damage

Stage 3 weakness 10 to positive damage, and each time the PC critically fails an attack roll or skill check they're @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} as their mind obsesses over the failure

Stage 4 as stage 3

Stage 5 as stage 3

Stage 6 The PC is reduced to an unthinking haunt. Until the curse is removed or the duration of the transmigrate ritual ends, they repeat a short loop of actions and are no longer under the control of the player (unlimited duration).

Effect: Spore Feedback.name: Effect: Spore Feedback
Effect: Spore Feedback.description: Treerazer's maximum Hit Points are reduced to 500 and his regeneration reduces to 30.

Effect: Stoop.name: Effekt: Bücken
Effect: Stoop.description: Mittelgroße Kreaturen sind gezwungen, gebückt zu gehen und ihre Waffen verkrampft anders zu führen, daher erleiden sie einen Situationsmalus von -1 auf alle Angriffswürfe und erhalten den Zustand @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Unbeholfen 1}.

Effect: Tarnbreaker Champions.name: Effect: Tarnbreaker Champions
Effect: Tarnbreaker Champions.description:
Granted by Tarnbreaker Champions

you gain a +1 circumstance bonus on all Diplomacy checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.DCb62iCBrJXy0Ik6]{Make a Request} while playing in an adventure that takes place primarily in the Lands of the Linnorm Kings.

Effect: Technological Defence.name: Effect: Technological Defence
Effect: Technological Defence.description:
Granted by Technological Defence.

You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to a saving throw against a technological weapon or effect.

Effect: Tiger Form.name: Effect: Tiger Form
Effect: Tiger Form.description:
The polymorphed character transforms into a Large animal. Each polymorphed character gains the following statistics and abilities regardless of which form they choose.

  • AC = 36.
  • 30 temporary Hit Points.
  • Low-light vision and scent (imprecise) 30 feet.
  • One or more unarmed melee attacks specific to the battle form, which are the only attacks you can use. (You are trained with them.) You can use your own unarmed attack modifier if it is better.
  • Athletics modifier of +26 unless yours is better.
  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.adventure-specific-actions.Item.LVSGvlzI1rGWtGJA]{Rallying Display} 1 (auditory, visual) You roar or otherwise make a show of bestial strength. You automatically roll a success to rally the crowd for your team.
  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.adventure-specific-actions.Item.oUP8jylH97ZbRvfw]{Reposition Chains} 1 You pull on the chains, moving a willing chained ally up to 10 feet to a space within your reach.

Speed 30 feet

Melee 1 jaws +25, Damage 3d6+16 piercing plus @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.Tkd8sH4pwFIPzqTr]{Grab}

Melee 1 claw +25 (agile), Damage 2d8+16 slashing

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.adventure-specific-actions.Item.GSLSCo0OWDUtET4e]{Wrestle} 1 You make a claw Strike against a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} by you. If you hit, you deal damage as usual and that creature is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Effect: Utter Treerazer's Name.name: Effect: Utter Treerazer's Name
Effect: Utter Treerazer's Name.description: Decrease Treerazer's saving throw modifiers, Perception check modifiers, and skill check modifiers by 3.

Effect: Wind Barrier.name: Effekt: Windbarriere
Effect: Wind Barrier.description:
Gewährt durch @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.adventure-specific-actions.Item.UEBVXi4VSQf70ggQ]{Windbarriere}

Du erhältst einen Situationsbonus von +2 auf RK gegen Fernkampfangriffe. Auf der 13. Stufe erhöht sich der Bonus auf +3.

Effect: Worldly Mentor.name: Effect: Worldly Mentor
Effect: Worldly Mentor.description:
Granted by Worldly Mentor

Your Level Bump bonus modifier to perception checks increases by 2.

Geb's Blessing.name: Geb's Blessing
Geb's Blessing.description:
Each character gains resistance 20 to two of the following damage types of their choice: acid, bludgeoning, cold, electricity, fire, piercing, poison, slashing, sonic, vitality, or void. They also gain 40 temporary Hit Points for 24 hours. Finally, each character gains the following two special abilities, each usable once.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.adventure-specific-actions.Item.MgSwLes5lp3TE1ZV]{Mental Ward}

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.adventure-specific-actions.Item.TM4pOPSM9r7XEM64]{Soul Ward}

Malevolence.name: Bosheit
Malevolence.description:
Während die Bosheit langsam von Kreaturen Besitz ergreift, werden Körper, Geist und Seele zunehmend von der übernatürlichen Kraft heimgesucht, welche die Villa Xarwin heimsucht. In diesem Abenteuer können die SC den besonderen Zustand Bosheit erlangen. Der Zustand Bosheit hat immer auch einen Wert. Du erleidest auf alle Rettungswürfe gegen Effekte, die von Spukerscheinungen ausgelöst werden, sowie gegen Flüche und Besessenheitseffekte einen Zustandsmalus in Höhe dieses Zustands. Der Wert des Zustands Bosheit kann durch Genesung reduziert werden.

Der Zustandswert von Bosheit kann nicht über 4 ansteigen. Sollte ein Effekt den Zustandswert über 4 anheben, erleidet die Kreatur für 24 Stunden den Zustand @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Benommen 1}, während die Bosheit einige zufällig ausgewählte Erinnerungen aus dem Kurzzeitgedächtnis verschlingt. Eine Kreatur mit einem Zustandswert von 4 kann die Villa Xarwin nicht mehr freiwillig verlassen.

Wenn man eine Nacht ruhigen Schlafs in einem Gebiet genossen hat, welches nicht unter dem Einfluss der Bosheit steht, reduziert sich der Wert des Zustands Bosheit um 1.

Mixed Drink: Dancing Lights.name: Effekt: Tanzende Lichter
Mixed Drink: Dancing Lights.description: Du kannst innerhalb des nächsten Tages einmal @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.WBmvzNDfpwka3qT4]{Licht} als Naturzaubertrick wirken.

Mixed Drink: Guidance.name: Effekt: Göttliche Führung
Mixed Drink: Guidance.description: Du kannst innerhalb des nächsten Tages einmal @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.izcxFQFwf3woCnFs]{Göttliche Führung} als Naturzaubertrick wirken.

Mixed Drink: Luck.name: Effekt: Eine Portion Glück
Mixed Drink: Luck.description: Eine Portion Glück: Wenn du in den nächsten 8 Stunden einmal einen Rettungswurf oder einen Fertigkeitswurf ablegst, darfst du zweimal würfeln und das höhere Ergebnis nehmen. Dies ist ein Glückseffekt.

Mixed Drink: Prestidigitation.name: Effekt: Zaubertrick
Mixed Drink: Prestidigitation.description: Du kannst innerhalb des nächsten Tages einmal @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Qw3fnUlaUbnn7ipC]{Zaubertrick} als Naturzaubertrick wirken.

Persona Trait.name: Persona Trait
Persona Trait.description:
Celebrities, including famous adventurers like your PCs, don't always present themselves to the public in a way that accurately reflects who they are. In Curtain Call, each PC will select a persona trait. Regardless of your character's personality, motives, and goals, the public's perception of their legend may be quite different as a result of rumors, misinterpreted events, fanciful imaginings, or even deliberate attempts by a character to foster a different persona.

There are eight persona traits you can choose from for your PC. The trait you adopt doesn't have to match your character's actual personality or role, but if you pick one that's off the mark, be prepared for NPCs you encounter to make some curious assumptions about your character! Note that while each persona trait has a positive and negative aspect to it, both of these elements are strictly narrative and have no mechanical effects on your character's abilities. Think of them as roleplaying tools that you can use to help guide your PC's actions during the campaign. These traits do, however, have an impact on the adventures: in certain parts of Curtain Call, characters with specific persona traits will be particularly well-suited to face certain challenges and will gain one-time boons and bonuses that help them navigate the encounter in question. Your GM has all of this information and will inform the party whenever persona traits come into play.

The eight persona traits are:

Flirt: The public perceives you as the most romantic of the group, and you may be thought of as a seducer or vapid pretender who gets by on their looks and brings nothing of value to the party.

Guardian: The public perceives you as the healer and protector of the group, but some may also consider you too soft-hearted and meek to be a "true hero."

Leader: The public perceives you as the leader of the group, but some likewise consider you too brash or even pompous.

Scholar: The public considers you the problem-solver and brains of the group, though some also perceive you as arrogant or incapable of physical tasks.

Scoundrel: The public is convinced you are the "bad boy/bad girl" of the group who gets the distasteful but necessary things done, but who is at times thought of as a criminal or potential traitor to the party.

Underdog: The public perceives you as a "fish out of water"—someone who accidently got swept up by the group and still manages to triumph, but who is sometimes thought of as a weak link or loser.

Warrior: The public believes you are the strong-arm of the group, the person who excels in a fight but is also at times considered cruel, uncouth, or even a bully.

Wildcard: The public perceives you as a source of whimsy, outlandish ideas, and comedy in the group, but that reputation is a double-edged sword, as some also consider you a liability or unreliable.

Resonant Reflection: Reflection of Life.name: Resonant Reflection: Reflection of Life
Resonant Reflection: Reflection of Life.description:
You regain double the normal number of Hit Points when resting (meaning you regain double your Constitution modifier multiplied by your level). The healing you gain from long-term rest is similarly doubled. In addition, you can focus this healing energy to accelerate your body's natural healing processes even further.

Activate 2 envision

Frequency once per day

Effect You gain fast healing 3 for 1 minute. This amount of fast healing increases by 1 for every 2 levels you have beyond 5th level.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.campaign-effects.Item.DOxl0FDd21VMDOMP]{Effect: Reflection of Life (Fast Healing)}

Resonant Reflection: Reflection of Light.name: Resonant Reflection: Reflection of Light
Resonant Reflection: Reflection of Light.description:
Your eyes are imbued with an inner light that is not visible externally but that provides you with darkvision and the ability to distinguish color in darkness. You can also focus this inner light to manifest as a brilliant beam of energy from your eyes.

Activate 2 envision

Frequency once per day

Effect You cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.DyiD239dNS7RIxZE]{Holy Light} as an innate divine spell, heightened to a spell rank equal to half your level rounded up.

Resonant Reflection: Reflection of Stone.name: Resonant Reflection: Reflection of Stone
Resonant Reflection: Reflection of Stone.description:
Your body is infused with the resilience and durability of stone. You are protected against the effects of severe cold and severe heat. In addition, you can also focus this durability to gain an additional effect.

Activate 2 envision

Frequency once per day

Effect You cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.2BV2yYPfVJ5zirZt]{Mountain Resilience} as an innate divine spell, heightened to a spell rank equal to half your level rounded up.

Resonant Reflection: Reflection of Storm.name: Resonant Reflection: Reflection of Storm
Resonant Reflection: Reflection of Storm.description:
Your body is inured to the devastation inflicted by natural forces. You gain resistance to electricity damage equal to your level. You don't treat wind as difficult terrain or greater difficult terrain while flying, and you can't be moved by wind unless you choose to be. You gain a +1 status bonus to saves against primal magic. In addition, you can absorb this reinvigorating energy into your body to gain the following effect.

Activate 2 envision

Frequency once per day

Effect You cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.4MOew29Z1oCX8O28]{Moment of Renewal} (self only) as an 8th-rank divine innate spell and regain 1 Focus Point.

Resonant Reflection: Reflection of Water.name: Resonant Reflection: Reflection of Water
Resonant Reflection: Reflection of Water.description:
Your body is infused with the essence of water and becomes adapted to its presence. You gain a swim speed of 10 feet and can breathe underwater. In addition, you can also focus this affinity to gain an additional effect.

Activate 2 envision

Frequency once per day

Effect You cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.zfn5RqAdF63neqpP]{Control Water} as a 5th-rank innate divine spell. The area of water you control increases by 10 feet in length and width for every 2 levels you have beyond 10th level.
